intro: Astragalus pakistanicus, commonly known as the Pakistan milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Pakistan. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its seeds are often dispersed by wind, aiding in its propagation across fragmented habitats.
